title: Not running after restart
body:
Went to sleep lastnight and left my node to sync, woke up and Geth.exe was nowhere to be seen mustve crashed or something. Now restarting Geth with  "start geth.exe --datadir "G:\Geth"" just brings me here

```
-----------
```

I waited quite awhile longer and something quickly flashed mentioned unclean shutdown before closing the Geth.exe terminal.
Im deleting chaindata as im typing this and just gonna resync chain hopefully that fixes it


Nvm:
N̶o̶t̶h̶i̶n̶g̶s̶ h̶a̶p̶p̶e̶n̶s̶ a̶f̶t̶e̶r̶ t̶h̶i̶s̶, a̶n̶y̶b̶o̶d̶y̶ k̶n̶o̶w̶ w̶h̶y̶?̶

I'm also stuck since block 15090000

I made a new issue because I'm not sure if your issue is the same as mine #25260
@j-dbooth let us know if your re-sync doesn't work.

re-sync worked but then again i had to close geth with ctrl+c waited a few mins and then restarted using 
'start geth.exe --datadir "G:\Geth" --maxpeers "75" --cache "6144" --txpool.globalslots "60000" --txpool.globalqueue "4000"'
for some reason its given me same issue as before... i did stop the node yesterday a few times while it was still resyncing and it relaunched fine then

`INFO [07-09|13:04:08.747] Starting Geth on Ethereum mainnet...

i also cant ipc into it either in this state

it finally started just takes 30mins from there to actually launch fully... is this normal or should i swap out my external 1tb ssd? im running a ryzen 7 2700x with ddr4 3200Mhz 2x16GB RAM, cant see cpu or RAM being the issue tbh
